definition: to reside/to live/to dwell/to be in/to be situated at/to stay/to get along with/to be in a position of/to deal with/to discipline/to punish
place/location/spot/point/office/department/bureau/respect/classifier for locations or items of damage: spot, point

sentences.english: Birds floating so close together in some places that she couldn't see the water.
sentences.chinese: 于某处游在一起以致她看不到水面。

sentences.english: His headquarters are somewhere in the Everglades, his gang are a mixed-up bunch.
sentences.chinese: 其总部设在某处沼泽地，他的团伙是一个混合了一堆。

sentences.english: And somewhere shining snow polished by the wind.
sentences.chinese: 某处被风抛光的雪闪耀着光芒。

sentences.english: If we want to "get somewhere" in life, this is Saturn talking.
sentences.chinese: 如果我们想到达生命中的某处，这便是土星在发话。
他住在海格特区附近某处。

sentences.english: I am somewhere in Rwanda when my car breaks down.
sentences.chinese: 当我的车出现故障的时候，我正在卢旺达某处。

sentences.english: As for my men, I have told them to meet me at a certain place.
sentences.chinese: 故此我已派定少年人在某处等候我。

sentences.english: AWOL means you were supposed to be somewhere but were not.
sentences.chinese: AWOL是指你应该在某处，但是并没有在。

sentences.english: Could you go where people can see someone like me?
sentences.chinese: 某处若有我这样一个人，你可会去？

sentences.english: Japanese macaque swims in a geothermal hot spring in the mountains of Japan.
sentences.chinese: 一只日本猕猴在日本某处山间温泉里泡汤。

sentences.english: Somewhere along the way I lost my umbrella.
sentences.chinese: 我把雨伞丢失在沿途某处了。

sentences.english: This class must be found somewhere on the classpath.
sentences.chinese: 该类必须能够在类路径的某处找到。

sentences.english: For every beauty there is an eye somewhere to see it.
sentences.chinese: 每一个美都有一只眼睛在某处看着。

sentences.english: He gets up at the crow of the rooster every day.
sentences.chinese: 天亮了，我听到从某处传来雄鸡的报晓声。

sentences.english: A small temple once lay somewhere in the hill.
sentences.chinese: 在山丘的某处，曾经有座小庙。

sentences.english: We knew that he had some problems somewhere from his maladroit movements.
sentences.chinese: 从他笨拙的动作我们就知道了他身体某处有问题。

definition: to cover up/to conceal/to go into hiding
to hide/to go into hiding/to take refuge
to conceal oneself/to go into hiding/to take cover
to roam all over the place/to go into every nook and corner/to infiltrate/(of criminals, enemies etc) to be on the run/to flee and try to hide
to wander/to roam about/to loaf about/to be idle
to stay for a time/to stop over/to lodge/to sink down (into soft ground)/leftovers
